segments.title: warm up - Baseketball Tag.
segments.notes:
Baseketball Tag.
1 pair inside the 2.  ball tag others.

segments.title: cut to basket
segments.notes:
Need 2 players and 1 coach.
Player 1 baseline
Player 2 at point

Player 1 passes to coach and closes out player 2.
Player 2 flash cuts IN front of his defender to get open
Coach passes to player 2 who attacks and it's 1v1 to bucket.

teaching_points.teachingPoint_short_description:
Need 2 players and 1 coach.
Player 1 baseline
Player 2 at point

Player 1 passes to coach and closes out player 2.
Player 2 flash cuts IN front of his defender to get open
Coach passes to player 2 who attacks and it's 1v1 to bucket.

segments.title: 2 v 1 - corner
segments.notes:
3 side .. corer gets ball runs to short corner (jump stop pivit pass back to corner), wing and point drift to corner and wing.

Corner recieves and 2 v 1 to basket.

teaching_points.teachingPoint_short_description:
Need 2 players and 1 coach.
Player 1 baseline
Player 2 at point

Player 1 passes to coach and closes out player 2.
Player 2 flash cuts IN front of his defender to get open
Coach passes to player 2 who attacks and it's 1v1 to bucket.

teaching_points.teachingPoint_name: lay up, in bound and trap
teaching_points.teachingPoint_short_description:
lay ups and in bounding. (10 makes - can adjust layup style) limit balls.
Great teaching points for Junior boys.
+ adapted to add defensive trap on top of inbound ball (teaching how to hunt) - 

# 3 traps to change trappers.
# 10 makes before changing up lay-up.

segments.title: 3 v 3 DHO to bucket
segments.notes: insert

teaching_points.teachingPoint_short_description:
create chaos and confusion for defence with this 3v3 game

When he said go, if you can get out wide, we want to advance pass it (not just watch in confines of drill)

3 man weave DHO, when coach says go - attack basket (3v3)

segments.title: scrimmage
segments.notes:
pass outside the 3 or inside the key.
reinforce intent to use what we practice not take poor shots.

segments.title: Team Discussion
segments.notes: Retro on last game.

teaching_points.teachingPoint_short_description: focus is on cutting - 3 dribbles max - full court scrimmage

teaching_points.teachingPoint_name: lay up, in bound and trap
teaching_points.teachingPoint_short_description:
lay ups and in bounding. (10 makes - can adjust layup style) limit balls.
Great teaching points for Junior boys.
+ adapted to add defensive trap on top of inbound ball (teaching how to hunt) - 

# 3 traps to change trappers.
# 10 makes before changing up lay-up.

segments.title: d2
segments.notes:
pick spot on 3 point arch.
2 minutes on clock.
see how many team can knock down.

title: U14 Boys - Plan B
notes:
U14 Boys - Plan B
Shorter session

segments.title: ball tap and finish in paint
segments.notes: options from state finalist finishing video

segments.title: shell drill
segments.notes:
4 defense baseline
4 offense around arch (corner/wing/corner/wing)

Need 5 passes start, then limit to 10 seconds

teaching_points.teachingPoint_short_description:
Rules:
1) If you pass, you must cut â€“ either to the basket or through to the weak side.
 2) If a teammate cuts and you're next to the open space, you must replace to keep the spacing.

This is an important foundation for building on top of this system.

segments.title: shell drill (with hook and look)
segments.notes:
Add another layer to shell drill with hook and look.
We're already doing this, but this formalises with clearer spots to stand and actions to move on.

4 defense baseline
4 offense around arch (corner/wing/corner/wing)

Need 5 passes start, then limit to 10 seconds
1 pass must be a hook and look,
high/low or short corner:
- cut into key > stay until next completed pass is caught 
- then move back out to perim (or another spot)
- do not stay inside key for more than 3 seconds

teaching_points.teachingPoint_name: Read & React Layer 3: hook and look - demo
teaching_points.teachingPoint_short_description:
Must set up post markers

cut to key - hook and look for the ball.
Stay until next pass is caught.
Move

segments.title: Post Moves (drop step)
segments.notes:
Could add the hook and look.
Defense is not allowed to look back (to show game play).
Offense can shoot or pass to post move?

teaching_points.teachingPoint_short_description:
4 kids.

wing and low post - both sides.

start wing, shotfake then > pass into low post
low post receive (drop step/turn and shoot)
rebound and kick out to opposite side to reset.

segments.title: Post Moves (up and under)
segments.notes:
Could add the hook and look.
Defense is not allowed to look back (to show game play).
Offense can shoot or pass to post move?

teaching_points.teachingPoint_short_description:
4 kids.

wing and low post - both sides.

start wing, shotfake, side step > pass into low post
low post receive (pivot - either baseline or to foul line) > shot fake and score.
If you need to dribble (only 1 once between legs) - but try to avoid it)

rebound and kick out to opposite side to reset.

segments.title: press break inbounding
segments.notes: simplified press break inbound after score - (simplified version of sideline)

teaching_points.teachingPoint_name: break press when inbounding after score.
teaching_points.teachingPoint_short_description:
1-2-2 press breaker.

simpler version of sideline -
See BFC diamond press breaker for additional context and positioning.

segments.title: Basketball Tag
segments.notes: In blue d - tag and run

segments.title: Onball screen
segments.notes:
3 O players, one in each corridor.  BH in middle.
3 x def in front

BH passes to next corridor, then runs over and sets on ball screen.

BH steps middle using screen 2 dribble back to middle, then pass out and onball screen. passes back to middle,

teaching_points.teachingPoint_short_description:
3 on 3 - each in a slot.
middle pass and set on ball to side

Help side defense - must be low

segments.title: teach kids space..
segments.notes: space and corridor discussion.

segments.title: Birds in a box
segments.notes:
4 offense players around keyway box.
3 defenders inside - must get 3 stationary passes then play to basket.

segments.title: scrimmage
segments.notes: can only catch inside key or outside 3.

segments.title: SLOB plays for u12
segments.notes:
4v4 start from SLOB.

2 near ball doing off ball screen
1 in far corner baseline
opposite corner half court line.

when ref hands ball to us,
start a screen action and runners start to move, we're looking for getz pass intercept to basket.

segments.title: Paper Rock Scissors
segments.notes: PRS

drills.title: Rock Paper Scissors Tag
drills.drillDescription: Fun warm up game to get players ready to practice and compete
drills.purpose: warm up and add mental load
drills.coachingPoints: Basketball posture, hips down, chest up, weak side dribble
drills.instructions:
Get into pairs.  Everyone has a ball.
Face eachother > pound dribble - wrong side 
Play 1 round of rock paper scissors
winner turns and bolts to side line - if they arrive with out being tagged, they get 1 point
loser follows, if they manage to tag, they reverse and loser bots to other side line - if they get there with out tag, get 1 point.  if tagged reset.

First to 5 points wins the game
drills.source: July 2025 - Wyndham coaching clinic - Coach Liam Flynn -  handout (From Rick)

segments.title: shoulder runs
segments.notes: shoulder runs (adapt to half court - work on footwork and containment.

drills.title: 1v1 Shoulder Runs  (20250803)
drills.drillDescription: tbc - not sure what this is - not bullyball?
drills.purpose: defense - contain and push to corner.   Offense - explode and create advantage
drills.coachingPoints:
defense - keep offense along sideline, nose on shoulder.
offense - explode/hesi and finishing
drills.instructions:
line up on baseline, in corner.
run hard to centre and then 1v1 to basket.
drills.source: wyndham rep 20250803

segments.title: Pressure
segments.notes: pressure

drills.title: 3v2 Rapid Traps and layups (half court)
drills.drillDescription: coach trapping, escaping and defending down the line
drills.purpose: coach trapping, escaping and defending down the line
drills.coachingPoints:
defense - trap approachs from blind spot, push points are corners.  try and get steal (no foul), use centreline, sideline to advantage.  only trap in designated situations.

If trapped, be decisive take 2 hard dribbles and go somewhere then move the ball quickly

Offense - get out of trouble (protect ball, pivot, pass under duress).
drills.source: wyndham rep 20250803

segments.title: 3v2 Rapid layups and traps
segments.notes: 3v2 Rapid layups and traps

drills.drillDescription: coach trapping, escaping and defending down the line

segments.title: 1v1 Bullets
segments.notes: 1v1 Bullets

drills.title: Bullets (1v1)
drills.drillDescription: Putting dribble moves and finishes into game scenarios
drills.coachingPoints:
move on the move (eg watch for move to start). Explode, "be trickey", attack angle.
Defense - force wide, not middle
drills.instructions: O starts with live dribble.  A crossover dribble game is live.  D must get both heels outside the 3..  8 second shotclock.
drills.source: July 2025 - Wyndham coaching clinic - Coach Liam Flynn -  handout (From Rick)

segments.title: DKS
segments.notes: drill DKS formation, instead of shoot, drive for a back cut.  *4v3?

drills.title: Drive - Kick - Swing (continous)
drills.drillDescription: Drive - Kick - Swing  (continous)
drills.purpose: crowd paint by drive, kick to clear and 1 to find new lane (no drive on drive)
drills.coachingPoints: do not drive on drive.  Fill corners, paint touch, get out opposite (swing) - add a little game to finish.
drills.instructions:
4 players outside of the 3 point line.
Start with pass from coach and first penetration, Drivers passes out and relocates out.
Reciever makes another pass to wing, who drives again

2. 
4v3 +1 advantage - apply dks in live situation.

4v4 O dribbles around the cone with D trailing.  Play 4v3 (+1)

frist to 3 points.  Alternate positions.

read the dribble, sprint, beat the ball to spot.
drills.source: July 2025 - Wyndham coaching clinic - Coach Liam Flynn - handout (From Rick)

segments.title: Team discussion on AHP
segments.notes:
How to beat arrow head press.
30% game worked brilliantly

70 didn't because:
a) AHP
b) JA/AD should not be designated BH
c) Read and respond

Communicate sideline / set up drill (3 AHP vs 4 sideline half court.
Practice screens and put hats down.

start trigger is layup.. then inbound positions
trap and scope 1 points
get of dodge and scope 2 points.

segments.title: Team Discussion
segments.notes:
Down 10 points in the first, Down 20 in second. Team energy is down - Everyone is frustrated.
How do we get back into the game?
What actions can you take to lift the team?
What is the single biggest thing you could do?

segments.title: Star Passing
segments.notes:
4 players start on 2 elbows and low  blocks.  
inbound from baseline.
facing basket - 
Left  inbound to right elbow, to left low block to right low block to right elbow - drive to basket.
Run to where you pass.
loud voice - clean passing - fast movement


Get #20 without missing.

new line with different colour ball - add 2nd ball (different colour) 
Run to where you pass.

teaching_points.teachingPoint_short_description:
Start passing warm up

no dribble - good movement.
    
https://youtu.be/qaQKiZsLNYU?t=8
https://youtu.be/qaQKiZsLNYU?t=74

segments.title: Pass and Cut Triangles
segments.notes:
Pass and cut.
Get it going both sides - face cut, and finish in paint.
Voice, hands.

Offense read defensive footwork
Defence - no foul, read lead foot.

segments.title: Boxing out
segments.notes:
4 middle (2 yellow/2 blue)
4 shooters (2 yellow/2 blue)

Box out and kick out to shooter > hot potatoe pass to open wing/corner.

First team to 10 wins (box out gets 2 points) - 3 gets 1 point
shooters must alternate 3 and mid range shots (step in) .

voices

drills.title: Box out and Rebound
drills.drillDescription: Box out and Rebound.  Play to x stops and rotate
drills.purpose: Increase Box out rotations
drills.coachingPoints: Box out (seal, pushback_

segments.title: AIS Shooting
segments.notes:
Compete 4v4 across 3 spots.
First team to get 9 (last 2 shots must be in a row, for winning team to progress).

Low Block
Short Corner
Elbow
Free throw (adjacent)

Usually the team who wins this is creating good energy - good voice.

teaching_points.teachingPoint_short_description:
a) 2 teams opposing short corner shots (First to 9, last 2 must be in a row)
b) low block
c) Elbows
d) middle free throw, both sides.

all players (except 2) at half court right side.

driver becomes cutter.

segments.title: 215- add defence
segments.notes:
Driver must get feet into paint, then kick to wing.
Defence and offense must race to 3 point line, then both cut back to get pass to bucket

Rotations.  defence to wing, offense to defense, wing to line

add defense and cut rotations - looks good

stop middle penetration

title: U14 Boys - Plan (Sep- week 2) SF

segments.title: Team Discussion
segments.notes:
Game Factors
- ball handlers
a) mismatch in key
b) zone defense
c) must pass/cut/replace
d) get through set before attempting any 3 point shots

Key Takeaway - we need to work on offensive spacing (there was a lot of space in they key, but we didnâ€™t find it.

Last time - offensive passing hurt us in the first half.

drills.title: Drive - Kick - Swing (continous)
drills.drillDescription: Drive - Kick - Swing  (continous)
drills.purpose: crowd paint by drive, kick to clear and 1 to find new lane (no drive on drive)
drills.coachingPoints: do not drive on drive.  Fill corners, paint touch, get out opposite (swing) - add a little game to finish.
drills.instructions:
4 players outside of the 3 point line.
Start with pass from coach and first penetration, Drivers passes out and relocates out.
Reciever makes another pass to wing, who drives again

2. 
4v3 +1 advantage - apply dks in live situation.

4v4 O dribbles around the cone with D trailing.  Play 4v3 (+1)

frist to 3 points.  Alternate positions.

read the dribble, sprint, beat the ball to spot.
drills.source: July 2025 - Wyndham coaching clinic - Coach Liam Flynn - handout (From Rick)

segments.title: 3 vs Zone

set up 3 vs zone - targeting pass, cut replace and drive kick swing, back cuts and  hook and look.
a) pistols into hook and look.
b) DKS around a zone
c) passing around shell - of crap passes (L cut in, V cut to get open)
d) swing ball top (looking for ball watchers) base cuts.

Coach can joint as offense

drills.title: 3v2 (Rapid)
drills.drillDescription: 3v2 (Rapid), need 7 and full court
drills.purpose: Full court continuous 3v2
drills.setup:
1. 3 offsenive players one end with ball.  2 Defence players the other end.  Offsense plays down hill.
2. the offensive player (which is whoever turns the ball over or scores), joins defense and transition to other end (where 2 players are waiting) - keep rolling for a set period or number of baskets.

the other 2 offensive players become defense, wait in position for next group to attack
drills.coachingPoints: O - draw man, decieve.  D - Talk (ball/basket) decision making.
drills.instructions: 3 Offensive players roll down hill to 2v3
drills.source: (2025 Wyndham Rep)

segments.title: defensive transtion
segments.notes: defensive transtion

teaching_points.teachingPoint_short_description:
3 on 3 - each in a slot.
middle pass and set on ball to side

Help side defense - must be low
get over a screen - Heel, hand, hip

create chaos and confusion for defence with this 3v3 game

When he said go, if you can get out wide, we want to advance pass it (not just watch in confines of drill)

3 man weave DHO, when coach says go - attack basket (3v3)

create chaos and confusion for defence with this 3v3 game

add in turnover is fast break down other end (need full court)

Some help defense explanations
https://youtu.be/9uXjyH54toM?t=1605
Help, Low, Ball.
Help, basket, ball
Gap/slit? - what is a definitive guide for this.  (Is this the same as stay or go?)

* if red get the ball, the outlet it to the coach - and reset positions (this is good!)
https://youtu.be/9uXjyH54toM?t=1759

recap on help, low (help is 1 pass away, low is basket) - is help deny/gap?
* https://youtu.be/9uXjyH54toM?t=1812

drills.title: 3-on-3 Defensive Positioning - Progression #1
drills.drillDescription: Three offensive players advance the ball down the court using only passes while three defenders focus on maintaining proper positioning and communication. Defenders must call out their role to reinforce defensive awareness. The drill emphasizes ball pressure, gap positioning, defensive spacing, awareness, and verbal communication.
drills.purpose:
This drill teaches defenders how to maintain proper defensive positioning as the ball moves. It reinforces on-
ball pressure, help-side rotations, and weak-side coverage while improving defensive communication and both half-court and transition defense habits.
drills.setup:
ðŸ€ Three offensive players start at one end of the court:
ðŸ€ One in the middle lane with the basketball.
ðŸ€ One near each of the sidelines, spread out wide.
ðŸ€ Three defenders match up with each offensive player.
drills.coachingPoints:
ðŸ€ Defenders need to constantly communicate. They must be loud and clear when calling out â€œBALL, HELP, LOW.â€
ðŸ€ On-ball defenders should keep their hands up to This drill teaches defenders how to maintain proper defensive positioning as the ball moves. It reinforces on- ball pressure, help-side rotations, and weak-side coverage while improving defensive communication and both half- court and transition defense habits.pressure the ball and contest passes.
ðŸ€ Ensure defenders are not overhelping or losing sight of their man.
ðŸ€ Defenders should stay low and ready, maintaining an athletic stance and moving on the flight of the ball
drills.instructions:
1. The middle offensive player starts with the ball.
2. The offensive players must pass the ball to each other
as they move down the court.
3. Defenders adjust their positioning based on the ballâ€™s
location:
âˆ’ â€œBALLâ€ â€“ The on-ball defender applies pressure.
âˆ’â€œHELPâ€ â€“ The defender one pass away fills the
gap.
âˆ’â€œLOWâ€ â€“ The weak-side defender drops to protect
the basket.
4. Defenders must call out their role loudly as the ball
moves.
5. The drill continues until the group reaches the
opposite end of the court.
6. Rotate offense and defense and repeat.
drills.source: Basketball for coaches, season 3, issue 9 + Damien cotter defence videos
